instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.R7021: What is R7021? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7022: What is R7022? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not running from AC Charger
threads.message:
Hi guys, i have a 2915 that runs on battery, green and orange light but on AC only it shows green light and no fan. Few measurement without battery:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>    12.62
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>  3.469
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>   0v
<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> = 20 ohm
<RESISTOR>R7021</RESISTOR>  = 10ohm
<RESISTOR>R7022</RESISTOR> = 10ohm

No short to ground on any of the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pins. Any ideas?

Greetz
Arno

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not running from AC Charger
threads.message: i think you need to investigate the <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> issue.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not running from AC Charger
threads.message: Using a REAL APPLE 85W charger will usually help......

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not running from AC Charger
threads.message: Im using original apple charger, that works with another mac.... im not that big of a noob.... but a noob nevertheless

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not running from AC Charger
threads.message: you need <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> for this machine to power on. I would inspect <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> to make sure this chip is functioning properly( voltage in, enable signals)

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not running from AC Charger
threads.message: If it works on the battery then this has nothing to do with <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> and everything to do with the SMC not telling it to turn on. What do you measure on <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> with battery unplugged and charger plugged in?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not running from AC Charger
threads.message: Reflowing SMC fixed the issue thanks guys!
